author: Ankha
comments:
Description: This deck is heavily inspired by Simo Tiippana's "Garou Rim: Foreshadowing Destruction" deck (TWD 11456) but I tweaked it a lot, removing the "bad" 8-cap barons to include smaller PRO vampire and reworking the master module.
I doubled all the key cards (so that the only copy doesn't end up in the bottom of the deck): Carfax (blood is crucial), Garibaldi (recursion is strong), and Club Illusion (because we need it to oust!). I played the deck at the EC, and noticed that the cardflow could be problematic, so I added two Heart of Nizchetus and a Powerbase: Los Angeles.
I didn't put The Uncoiling, but Scourge is really a pain in the a**, so it could be included somehow.
The Dark Influences completely screwed my predator during the final (by preventing him from getting a Renegade Garou with his 2-cap before any baron was out to block) and other predators during other rounds playing Immortal Grapple or whatever.
The Erciyes Fragments was a last-minute addition, allowing me to oust to preys with their own bleed cards, but also to retrieve Carrion Crows during the final to fight against the Renegade Garous. The Discipline spread is so wide that you can almost play any card.

cards.comments: to burn any annoying weapon (Sniper, Ivory Bow) or to deliver the final blow
cards.name: Anarch Troublemaker

cards.comments: "The blood is the life!"
cards.name: Carfax Abbey

cards.comments: plan A for ousting
cards.name: Club Illusion

cards.comments: a great defensive card
cards.name: Dark Influences

cards.comments: a last-minute addition, allowed me to oust to preys with their own bleed cards
cards.name: The Erciyes Fragments

cards.comments: as usual, gets back the bounce or intercept, or the killing votes
cards.name: Garibaldi-Meucci Museum

cards.comments: "The blood is the life!"
cards.name: Papillon

cards.comments: more blood, or if someone has already a Papillon or Carfax out
cards.name: Poacher's Hunting Ground

cards.comments: required to cycle more
cards.name: Powerbase: Los Angeles

cards.comments: we don't need 8 of them for the 8 Childe, as we never play them all. Can be used on some barons to give them PRO
cards.name: Protean

cards.comments: nice ot have, but not crucial at all
cards.name: Rötschreck

cards.comments: never drawn at the right time
cards.name: Tribute to the Master

cards.comments: probably better than Vessel / Blood Doll, allows to get more vampires out, and I rely on the HG to regain blood
cards.name: Villein

cards.comments: to contest, always useful anyway
cards.name: Aranthebes, The Immortal

cards.comments: bleed or Revolutionary fodder
cards.name: Childe of the Revolution

cards.comments: I removed it, then put it back because it's a great end-game card (before, it's just fun, no need to defend it)
cards.name: Constant Revolution

cards.comments: easy to call, recursive with Garibaldi
cards.name: Eat the Rich

cards.comments: endgame oust and/or threat removal (Ivory Bow or strong locations)
cards.name: Revolutionary Council

cards.comments: for the surprise bleed boost, recursive
cards.name: Monkey Wrench

cards.comments: I added it for the EC, never used
cards.name: Delaying Tactics

cards.comments: spam! spam! spam!
cards.name: Organized Resistance

cards.comments: agg threat is efficient (can be retrieved with Garibaldi)
cards.name: Donnybrook

name: Baron Protean
